services.description: Configure your SAP ERP or SAP S/4HANA products interactively in the cloud

metadata.longDescription: Variant Configuration service lets your sales teams, customers, and channel partners configure your products accurately and efficiently. Leverage your knowledge of the SAP variant configuration to model your products. That provides smooth end-to-end data flow between your cloud applications and your SAP back end. Relevant configuration models are replicated from the SAP ERP or SAP S/4HANA in the SAP Cloud to allow Variant Configuration service to use that data independently of the back-end load or availability.

services.description: Define and manage your jobs or Cloud Foundry tasks that run on one-time or recurring schedules.

metadata.longDescription: The Job Scheduling Service allows you to define and manage jobs that run once or on recurring schedules. Use this runtime-agnostic service to schedule REST endpoint actions in your application or to schedule long-running processes using Cloud Foundry tasks. Use REST APIs to schedule your jobs, including long-running jobs asynchronously, and create multiple schedule formats for both simple and complex recurring schedules. The Job Scheduling Service dashboard is a web interface that lets you manage jobs and schedules.

services.description: Automate business processes using workflow technology.

metadata.longDescription: SAP Workflow service allows you to build, run, and manage workflows, from simple approvals to end-to-end processes that span across different organizations and applications. With an inbox application and custom-built user interfaces, you involve end users into business processes for decision making and data entry. The workflow service comes with web-based tools for workflow modeling, APIs for consumption in custom applications, monitoring tools, and a set of Fiori-based applications for end-user access. You can use JavaScript to embed custom business logic. See Conventions, Restrictions, and Limits

services.description: Broker for Audit Log Service in CF

metadata.longDescription: The Audit Log Service Broker is the component that enables auditlogging in a given scenario. Use it by creating a service instance and either bind it to a CF application that will write auditlogs, or create a service-key for non-CF scenarios. Based on the service plan, the created service binding or service-key provide the required credentials to write auditlogs via the Audit Log REST API or one of the Audit Log Clients. While there are currently two active service plans for the Audit Log Service Broker, the currently recommended one is the 'oauth2' plan. The 'standard' plan will soon be deprecated and is left to enable migration towards the 'oauth2' plan.

services.description: Orchestrate, refine, enrich, apply intelligence on your governed data across your entire distributed data landscape.

metadata.longDescription: SAP Data Intelligence is the all-in-one data orchestration solution to discover, refine, enriche and govern any type, variety, and volume of data across your entire distributed data landscape. Deliver on the promise of AI with enterprise scale, trust, and transparency driving significant new business value and insights.

services.description: Leverage the in-memory data processing capabilities of SAP HANA in the cloud as one simple gateway to all data.

metadata.longDescription: SAP HANA Cloud allows you to leverage the in-memory data processing capabilities of SAP HANA in the cloud. As a managed database service, backups are fully automated and service availability guaranteed. Using SAP HANA Cloud, you can set up and manage SAP HANA databases and bind them to applications running on SAP Cloud Platform. You can access SAP HANA databases using a variety of languages and interfaces, as well as build applications and models using tools provided with SAP HANA. Furthermore, SAP HANA Cloud helps you to manage where and how data is stored and accessed, depending on performance needs.

services.description: Establishes a secure and reliable connectivity between cloud applications and on-premise systems.

metadata.longDescription: Use the Connectivity service to establish secure and reliable connectivity between your cloud applications and on-premise systems running in isolated networks.

services.name: connectivity

servicePlans.description: Establish secure connections to on-premise systems through SAP Cloud Connector

bullets: Connectivity established via shared service resources for all applications

servicePlans.name: lite

servicePlans.description: Pair Connectivity Proxy with SAP CP Connectivity service for establishing secure connections to on-premise systems through SAP Cloud Connector

bullets: Connectivity Proxy to be used as a dedicated or shared resource

servicePlans.name: connectivity_proxy

servicePlans.description: Perform administrative operations in the Connectivity service

bullets: Display all Cloud Connectors currently connected to a given subaccount
Trigger a force disconnect of a Cloud Connector connected to a given subaccount

servicePlans.name: admin

services.description: SAP Localization Hub, Tax Service

metadata.longDescription: This service enables you to determine and calculate indirect taxes for business transactions. The service supports you in complying with guidelines issued by the local authorities in selected countries/regions by providing sample tax calculation content.

services.name: tax-service

servicePlans.description: Standard Tax Service plan
servicePlans.name: standard

services.description: API Management, API portal service drives innovation in modern business models. Based on APIs and digital assets, the service facilitates unified access from new channels and diverse user interfaces. This is possible by enabling developer communities to connect to your enterprise information and processes securely. Here, the access to back-end services and complex landscapes are simplified with easy to consume APIs while protecting your systems from threats and overloaded access.

metadata.longDescription: API Management, API portal service drives innovation in modern business models. Based on APIs and digital assets, the service facilitates unified access from new channels and diverse user interfaces. This is possible by enabling developer communities to connect to your enterprise information and processes securely. Here, the access to back-end services and complex landscapes are simplified with easy to consume APIs while protecting your systems from threats and overloaded access.

services.name: apimanagement-apiportal

servicePlans.description: This plan lets you manage applications and APIs built on SAP BTP Cloud Foundry layer by binding it with API Management controls, that are already available in the Cloud Foundry environment. To use this plan, you must have already enabled API Management service on the Cloud Foundry environment and subscribed to API Management, API portal from the SAP BTP Cockpit.

bullets: Manage API calls to Cloud Foundry application.

servicePlans.description: The on-premise-connectivity plan allows you to generate a service key, consisting of user credentials like clientID, clientSecret, etc., by creating a service instance. These credentials are used in the enablement of Principal Propagation, making a desirable connection to the backend possible.

bullets: Enables Principal Propagation to achieve backend connectivity.

servicePlans.description: This plan enables api access for API Management.To use this plan, you must have already subscribed to API Management, API portal from the SAP BTP Cockpit.

services.description: Secure repository for credentials, cryptographic keys and certificates.

metadata.longDescription: Provides a secure repository for passwords and keys to the applications running on the SAP Cloud Platform, enabling the applications to retrieve them easily and use them for authentication to external services or for performing various cryptographic operations such as signing and verifying of digital signatures, encrypting of and decrypting of messages, and for performing TLS communication. The Credential Store service is exposed to applications via a RESTful API.

services.description: Leverage the in-memory data processing capabilities of SAP HANA in the cloud as one simple gateway to all data.

metadata.longDescription: SAP HANA Cloud allows you to leverage the in-memory data processing capabilities of SAP HANA in the cloud. As a managed database service, backups are fully automated and service availability guaranteed. Using SAP HANA Cloud, you can set up and manage SAP HANA databases and bind them to applications running on SAP Cloud Platform. You can access SAP HANA databases using a variety of languages and interfaces, as well as build applications and models using tools provided with SAP HANA. Furthermore, SAP HANA Cloud helps you to manage where and how data is stored and accessed, depending on performance needs.

services.name: hana-cloud-trial

services.description: API Management, API portal service drives innovation in modern business models. Based on APIs and digital assets, the service facilitates unified access from new channels and diverse user interfaces. services.description: Managed relational database service for PostgreSQL on AWS

listing.longDescription: AWS RDS PostgreSQL makes it easy to set up, operate, and scale PostgreSQL databases in Amazon Web Services cloud. Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL gives you access to the capabilities of the familiar PostgreSQL database engine. Amazon RDS manages complex and time-consuming administrative tasks such as installation and upgrades; storage management; high availability; and backups for disaster recovery.

metadata.longDescription: AWS RDS PostgreSQL makes it easy to set up, operate, and scale PostgreSQL databases in Amazon Web Services cloud. Amazon RDS for PostgreSQL gives you access to the capabilities of the familiar PostgreSQL database engine. Amazon RDS manages complex and time-consuming administrative tasks such as installation and upgrades; storage management; high availability; and backups for disaster recovery.

services.name: aws-rds-postgresql

servicePlans.description: AWS RDS PostgreSQL burstable performance instances, suitable for development/non-productive usage

metadata.longDescription: Create AWS RDS PostgreSQL instances that provide baseline performance level, with the ability to burst to full CPU usage.

servicePlans.name: development

adminPassword.description: The admin password for the DB instance. If not provided, the admin password is auto-generated

adminUsername.description: The admin username for the DB instance. If not provided, the admin username is auto-generated

backupRetentionPeriod.description: The number of days for which automated backups for the instance are retained. If not provided, the backup retention period is defaulted to 14 days

dbEngineMajorVersion.description: The major version of the PostgreSQL database to use. If not provided, the major version is defaulted to 9.6

dbInstanceType.description: The identifier for the compute and memory capacity of the instance. If not provided, the instance type is defaulted to db.t2.micro for the development plan

dbName.description: The name of the database to create when the DB instance is created. If not provided, the database name is auto-generated

multiAz.description: Indicates whether the instance is a multi-AZ deployment. If not provided, it is defaulted to false

resourceTechnicalName.description: The technical name of the AWS Resource Provider to use for provisioning the PostgreSQL RDS instance. The resource technical name must be provided mandatorily if there are more than one resource providers added to the subaccount

snapshotId.description: Identifier of the snapshot from which DB instance is created/restored. If not provided, empty database is created

storageEncrypted.description: Indicates whether the storage disks should be encrypted. If not provided, the flag is defaulted to false

storageGb.description: The amount of storage (in gibibytes) to allocate to the database instance. If not provided, the storage size is defaulted to 20GiB for the development plan

adminPassword.description: The admin password for the DB instance. If provided as part of an update operation, the existing admin password is updated

backupRetentionPeriod.description: The number of days for which automated backups for the instance are retained. If provided as part of the update operation, the backup retention period is updated

dbEngineMajorVersion.description: The major version of the PostgreSQL database to use. If provided as part of the update operation, the database engine version is updated

dbInstanceType.description: The identifier for the compute and memory capacity of the instance. If provided as part of the update operation, the instance capacity is upgraded. Providing a lesser instance type is not supported

multiAz.description: Indicates whether the instance is a multi-AZ deployment. If provided as part of the update operation, the availability setup is changed immediately

storageGb.description: The amount of storage (in gibibytes) to allocate to the database instance. If provided as part of the update operation, the storage size is upgraded immediately. Decreasing the storage size is not supported

services.description: Leverage the in-memory data processing capabilities of SAP HANA in the cloud as one simple gateway to all data.

metadata.longDescription: SAP HANA Cloud allows you to leverage the in-memory data processing capabilities of SAP HANA in the cloud. As a managed database service, backups are fully automated and service availability guaranteed. Using SAP HANA Cloud, you can set up and manage SAP HANA databases and bind them to applications running on SAP Cloud Platform. You can access SAP HANA databases using a variety of languages and interfaces, as well as build applications and models using tools provided with SAP HANA. Furthermore, SAP HANA Cloud helps you to manage where and how data is stored and accessed, depending on performance needs.

services.description: Create a Dynatrace environment and monitor your cloud applications and services.

metadata.longDescription: The Dynatrace Monitoring Service lets you create and configure your own Dynatrace environment and allows you to collect and analyze monitoring data of bound applications and services. This includes metrics, events, exceptions, and end-to-end traces. Supported by artificial intelligence with predictive capabilities, Dynatrace Monitoring Service offers you root-cause and dependency analysis so you can proactively observe and improve your application’s performance.

services.name: dynatrace

servicePlans.description: Create a Dynatrace environment and monitor your cloud applications and services.

environment_name.description: Name for the environment, max. 16 characters.

roles.description: Define which of the following roles you want to assign to your authorization entity: "admin","user","log_analytics","view_sensitive","configure_sensitive"

quotas.description: Provide quota settings for the Dynatrace environment (optional).

annual_limit.description: Provide limit for annual DEM Units quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Must be set together with 'monthly_limit'. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 0

monthly_limit.description: Provide limit for monthly DEM Units quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Must be set together with 'annual_limit'. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: 0

host_units.description: Provide quota settings for Host Units (optional).

limit.description: Provide limit for Host Units quota. Set to '-1' for unlimited quota. Omitting this field or sending it with 'null' value keeps the current value. Default: unlimited

You can analyze your logs at https://logs.cf.us10-001.hana.ondemand.com

services.description: Automatically increase or decrease the number of application instances based on a policy you define.
services.name: autoscaler

servicePlans.description: This plan allows four scaling rules and two schedules per policy document

bullets: Dynamic scaling based on application metrics, set a policy with up to 4 scaling rules and 2 schedules per bound app

servicePlans.name: lite

days_of_month.description: The list of the days of the month when to trigger scaling. Values ranging from 1 to 31

days_of_week.description: The list of the days of the week when to trigger scaling. Values ranging from 1 to 7

end_date.description: End date of the recurrence in YYYY-MM-DD format

end_time.description: End time of the recurrence in 24 hour format

initial_min_instance_count.description: The number of instances to scale up to as soon as the recurrence period starts

instance_max_count.description: Maximum number of instances to scale up during recurrence period

instance_min_count.description: The number of instances to scale down to once recurrence period

start_date.description: Start date of the recurrence in YYYY-MM-DD format

start_time.description: Start time of the recurrence in 24 hour format

adjustment.description: Magnitude of scaling in each step, +1 means scale up 1 Instance -2 means scale down 2 instances

breach_duration_secs.description: The length of the past period when a scaling action might be triggered based on metric usage

cool_down_secs.description: The interval between two successive scaling activity

services.description: Create, store, access, and analyze application logs.

You can analyze your logs at https://logs.cf.us10-002.hana.ondemand.com

metadata.longDescription: SAP Data Custodian’s Central Key Management Service (KMS) is a kernel service that allows customers to securely store and manage the lifecycle of their encryption keys. services.description: Unified access to SAP-managed data

metadata.longDescription:
SAP Graph's unified API exposes a unified graph-like model of business objects (entities) and relationships.
 SAP Graph uses open standards, such as OData v.4 and OAuth, thus allowing you to easily build applications and extensions for the SAP Intelligent Enterprise.

RESTRICTIONS. This Service is offered solely as a Beta. You may only use this Service to connect to non-productive SAP services for which you have a valid license agreement with SAP. You may not process any personal data with this Service.

metadata.longDescription: With Service Ticket Intelligence, incoming customers service tickets are automatically classified into their categories, and routed to the right agent. The agent is then provided with recommended solutions to improve operational efficiency. Service Ticket Intelligence leverages deep learning neural networks trained on large amounts of historical data. The model understands the semantics of unstructured ticket messages, classifies the ticket into their most likely categories and recommends solutions or knowledge base articles from similar previously answered tickets for the agent. With more processed service tickets and users feedback, the model improves over time.
